Comment: You should probably look into when the U.S. government actually tried rolling tanks and platoons into U.S. cities to quell riots, back in the 60s and 70s.  It went poorly. Civilians set up sniper nests and took out soldiers with impunity, moving from building to building via fire escapes and rooftops. Soldiers became so paranoid that they started to shoot at anything that moved, increasing the chaos on the ground. The military and the police clashed over who was in charge. The military and the civilian governments of states and cities clashed, especially when casualties started to mount. No one came out looking stronger, even if riots were eventually quelled.
